intro: Halenia cucullata, commonly known as the hooded bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often enclosed by a hood-like structure, giving it its common name. Halenia cucullata is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
